sentence.Network_en: The water is advancing at a rate of 5cm a day.
sentence.Network_cn: 水位正以每天5厘米的速度上升。

sentence.Network_en: Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital.
sentence.Network_cn: 来自乍得的报告显示叛军正向首都推进。

sentence.Network_en: Queen Milena possessed great beauty, which she retained unimpaired in advancing years.
sentence.Network_cn: 米莱娜女王倾国倾城，她的美貌并没有随着岁月的流逝而褪减。

新概念英语单词大全_百度文库 ... advance a. (只作定语)预先的 advance n. 进展 advantage n. 有利条件.

entry.def: To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone.

example.ex: Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital...
example.tran: 来自乍得的报告显示叛军正向首都推进。

example.ex: The water is advancing at a rate of 5cm a day...
example.tran: 水位正以每天5厘米的速度上升。

entry.def: To advance means to make progress, especially in your knowledge of something.

example.ex: Medical technology has advanced considerably...
example.tran: 医学技术突飞猛进。

example.ex: Japan has advanced from a rural, feudal society to an urban, industrial power.
example.tran: 日本已从封建农业社会发展成一个城市化工业强国。

entry.def: If you advance someone a sum of money, you lend it to them, or pay it to them earlier than arranged.

example.ex: I advanced him some money, which he would repay on our way home...
example.tran: 我先借给他一些钱，在我们回家的路上他会还给我的。

example.ex: The bank advanced $1.2 billion to help the country with debt repayments.
example.tran: 银行预支12亿美元帮助该国偿还债务。

entry.def: An advance is money which is lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.

example.ex: She was paid a £100,000 advance for her next two novels.
example.tran: 她接下来的两部小说得到了10万英镑的预付稿费。

entry.tran: 提前（未来事件的日期）；使（未来事件）提前发生
entry.def: To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date.

example.ex: Too much protein in the diet may advance the ageing process...
example.tran: 饮食中摄入过量蛋白质可能会加速衰老。

example.ex: The country's election commission has advanced the date of parliamentary elections by three days.
example.tran: 该国的选举委员会将议会选举日期提前了3天。

entry.tran: 促进，推动（事业、利益或主张）；使加速
entry.def: If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful.

example.ex: When not producing art of his own, Oliver was busy advancing the work of others.
example.tran: 奥利弗在不搞自己的艺术创作时，就会忙着帮助别人完成作品。

entry.def: When a theory or argument is advanced, it is put forward for discussion.

example.ex: Many theories have been advanced as to why some women suffer from depression...
example.tran: 就一些女性患抑郁症的原因，各种说法纷至沓来。

example.ex: An important set of ideas have been advanced by the biologist Rupert Sheldrake.
example.tran: 生物学家鲁珀特·谢尔德雷克已提出了一整套重要的观点。

entry.tran: （常指军事行动中的）前进，行进，推进
entry.def: An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.

example.ex: ...an advance on enemy positions...
example.tran: 向敌方阵地推进

example.ex: The defences are intended to obstruct any advance by tanks and other vehicles.
example.tran: 这些防御工事用于阻止坦克等车辆前进。

entry.def: If you make advances to someone, you try to start a sexual relationship with them.

example.ex: Mark had for some time been making advances towards her...
example.tran: 马克追她已经有一段时间了。

example.ex: She rejected his advances during the trip to Cannes.
example.tran: 在去往戛纳的途中，她拒绝了他的挑逗。

entry.def: An advance in a particular subject or activity is progress in understanding it or in doing it well.

example.ex: Air safety has not improved since the dramatic advances of the 1970s...
example.tran: 航空安全自从20世纪70年代得到显著提高之后，至今再没有任何改善。

example.ex: Their progress at work was mirrored by their children's educational advance.
example.tran: 子女在学业上有所进步，他们在工作上也就会有所起色。

entry.def: If something is an advance on what was previously available or done, it is better in some way.

example.ex: This could be an advance on the present situation.
example.tran: 这样可能会改善当前状况。

entry.def: Advance booking, notice, or warning is done or given before an event happens.

example.ex: They don't normally give any advance notice about which building they're going to inspect...
example.tran: 他们一般不会预先通知检查哪座大楼。

example.ex: The event received little advance publicity.
example.tran: 关于该事件事先几乎没有报道。

entry.def: An advance party or group is a small group of people who go on ahead of the main group.

example.ex: The 20-strong advance party will be followed by another 600 soldiers as part of UN relief efforts.
example.tran: 作为联合国救援行动的一部分，在这支由20多人组成的先头部队之后还将增派600名士兵。

entry.def: If one thing happens or is done in advance of another, it happens or is done before the other thing.

example.ex: I had asked everyone to submit questions in advance of the meeting.
example.tran: 我已请每个人在会议之前提交问题。

entry.def: If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event.

example.ex: The subject of the talk is announced a week in advance.
example.tran: 会谈的主题已提前一周宣布。

means.word_mean: 1. moving ahead or toward the front;

auth_sentence.content: Humans will pursue entertainment and culture or advancing science.
auth_sentence.res_content: Humans will pursue entertainment and culture or advancing science.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Humans will pursue entertainment and culture or advancing science.

auth_sentence.content: But Russian opposition could keep the measure from advancing.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Russian opposition could keep the measure from advancing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Russian opposition could keep the measure from advancing.

auth_sentence.content: Hillebrand leads a team of engineers advancing diesel technology.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hillebrand leads a team of engineers advancing diesel technology.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hillebrand leads a team of engineers advancing diesel technology.
